name: Sicilian Defense
description: The most popular response to 1.e4. Black fights for the center asymmetrically, leading to complex positions with chances for both sides.

startingMoves.comment: The Sicilian! Fighting for d4 control

variations.name: Open Sicilian
variations.description: The main line where White plays Nf3 and d4, leading to open tactical positions.

variations.name: Najdorf Variation
variations.description: The most popular and deeply analyzed Sicilian variation, favored by world champions Fischer and Kasparov.

moves.comment: The Najdorf! Preparing b5 and keeping options open

variations.name: Dragon Variation
variations.description: Black fianchettoes the bishop to g7, creating a 'dragon' formation. Sharp and tactical.

variations.name: Accelerated Dragon
variations.description: A quicker Dragon setup without d6, allowing d5 in one move later.

moves.comment: The Accelerated Dragon - no d6 yet!
